assessment.title: Major Functions of the Skeletal System

question.body: The knee allows movement independently front to back and by rotation. As such it is classified into two articulation types. What are they?

response.feedback: That is not quite right. Hinge is correct but gliding moves out of plane; pivot is correct.
That is not quite right. Saddle move in multiple directions, but are not as strong as hinges.
Correct. The knee moves front-and-back and can rotate slightly. As such, it is a pivotal hinge joint.
Incorrect. Hinge is correct but elliptical is not. The knee joint does seem like an ellipical joint since it seems non-symmetric, but anatomically it is not.

part.hint: Think about the types of joints which only go in one direction.
